The templates below are available:
instructions.deployNotFinished: Indexer is not yet deployed, please follow the instructions.
instructions.deployYourIndexer: Instructions to deploy your first Indexer
instructions.instruction1: Indexer deployments are handled over the Apillon CLI.
instructions.instruction2: Before you can see your indexer in the dashboard, please follow the step by step instructions below and deploy your indexer with the help of our CLI.
instructions.title: Features:
instructions.info: The indexing service from SQD.dev allows blockchain data to be collected, processed, and made searchable in an efficient manner. It enables applications to access and retrieve data from blockchain networks with ease, by transforming complex, unstructured blockchain data into organized, queryable formats. The service works by continuously monitoring the blockchain for new data, indexing it in real-time, and offering fast access to historical and live data through flexible API endpoints.

benefits: Real-time Data Processing: Continuously indexes new blockchain data for immediate access.
Historical Data Access: Easily retrieve past blockchain data for analysis or verification.
Customizable APIs: Flexible API endpoints enable tailored querying for specific blockchain data needs.
Multi-Blockchain Support: Seamlessly index data across various blockchain networks.
Scalability: Efficiently handles large amounts of data, suitable for high-traffic applications.

spendingWarning.btnBuyCredits: I want to buy credits right now
spendingWarning.content: To deploy an indexer, your project account must have at least 5,000 credits. This ensures the indexer can operate properly without interruptions.
spendingWarning.content2: Important: The 5,000 credits are not spent or reserved upfront.Credits are consumed gradually based on the volume of data being indexer. You have full control and can hibernate the indexer at any time to minimize credit usage.
spendingWarning.info: We will notify you via email when your credits are running low to help you stay on track.

indexer.hibernateIndexerInfo: Hibernation of indexer lets you pause virtual machines, lowering costs while keeping data safe. Wheen needed, redeploy the indexer with all data intact.
indexer.info: Add it to your Web3 project
